data.title: Zermelo Fraenkel Set Theory - 2 PDF
data.meta_description:
Zermelo Fraenkel set theory_2.pdf - Free download as PDF File (.pdf), Text File (.txt) or read online for free. 1. The axiom of choice states that for any collection of non-empty sets, it is possible to choose one element from each set to form a set. 
2. The axiom was formulated in 1904 by Ernst Zermelo to prove the well-ordering theorem. It is now commonly accepted and used in mathematics.
3. While originally controversial, the axiom of choice is now included in the standard Zermelo-Fraenkel set theory with the axiom of choice (ZFC). Some areas of constructive mathematics avoid it.
